revised_title: Inhibitory Excitation in the Medulla Oblongata and its Effects on the Vagus Nerves and Blood Vessels
tldr: The authors investigate the inhibitory effects of excitations in the medulla oblongata through the glossopharyngeal nerve on the vagus nerves and blood vessels. They observe that these inhibitions affect the origins of vagus fibers, the ends of vagus fibers that control respiration and heart movements, and the blood vessel regulation center in the medulla. This research sheds light on the complex interactions between the nervous and cardiovascular systems.
